Articles.Content:
I presume it's translated from some language where it makes more sense.

Not really, its made in UK by Frontier Developments

Looks like we've got new ships in beta 3!

And player interdictions!

That dropship (It's called like that) looks like something that has been taken from the Aliens universe.
first look vid from Mackscorner, very funny to watch:

I haven't tried it, simply because Elite: Dangerous is the silliest name I've ever heard. I presume it's translated from some language where it makes more sense.

A bit of history might help it make more sense. Elite - named after the original 1984 game, and Dangerous because the Elite universe always has been a dangerous one and (probably) as a nod to the 'Dangerous' combat ranking that you could earn in the original game.

A bit of history might help it make more sense. Elite - named after the original 1984 game, and Dangerous because the Elite universe always has been a dangerous one and (probably) as a nod to the 'Dangerous' combat ranking that you could earn in the original game.

If the second alternative is correct, then it would make some funny names for future games:

Elite: Mostly Harmless

Elite: Novice

Elite: Expert

and so on...

Edited October 26, 2014 by gmpd2000

If the second alternative is correct, then it would make some pretty funny names for future games:

Elite: Mostly Harmless

Elite: Novice

Elite: Expert

and so on...

I'm guessing that Elite: Average got chucked out by the marketing department pretty quickly.

Well, according to the Elite-Ranking Ladder the next game should be named Elite: Deadly ... and the one after that Elite: Elite

after that they run into problems as the ranking ladder officially stops there ... I guess the only possible step-up from this might be Elite: David Braben

Well, according to the Elite-Ranking Ladder the next game should be named Elite: Deadly ...

I think that name would also be rejected, imagine this:

-Look mom, that game is called Elite, it must be good!

-Be careful son, it's deadly.

Edited October 26, 2014 by gmpd2000

I imagine that name would also be rejected, imagine this:

-Look mom, that game is called Elite, it must be good!

-Be careful son, it's deadly.

And Elite: Elite was right out because of recursion.

And Elite: Elite was right out because of recursion.

Next Rockstar game should be:

Grand Theft Auto: Grand Theft Auto city stories?

We're getting off topic.

Oh my god, if you were on the Frontier forums you would see the TENSION rising.

Crazy things happening...

Come on Frontier, release it already!

Ok, from the 15 minutes I've played, Beta 3 is sweet. Yeah, there are still some bugs, but damn, it's better other than that! We did get partially reset; our ships and equipment are gone, but we have all the cash from that to our names, so it's not all bad. Also, I had a quick look at the galaxy map, and the Sol System is right on the border of playable space. Either we can visit it or we can't...

Seriously, I look forward to playing it more
oh sheet i didn't realise beta 3 was out! When did this happen!

oh sheet i didn't realise beta 3 was out! When did this happen!

Yesterday (10 chars)
I released this mounstrosity yesterday, before the launch:
Looks like they'll close beta access on the 22nd, so, if you wanna join beta, Do it now!

Looks like they'll close beta access on the 22nd, so, if you wanna join beta, Do it now!

From the newsletter:

Being a Beta backer extends far beyond getting early access to the game. All Beta (and Alpha) backers have access to the beta forums and we will continue to support Alpha and Beta backers with additional benefits and special offers in the future as a thank you for the early support you have given us.

Today we want to announce one of those benefits.

In Elite: Dangerous there will be areas of the game that will not be immediately accessible. Players may have to build a reputation with the governing faction in order to be given a permit to visit an area under their jurisdiction.

The Solar system, which is the star system of the birth of humanity, is restricted in this way. In the year 3300 humanity's homeworld has become a rich playground for the successful, the wealthy, and the powerful and famous. And of course, as a Beta backer, you belong in that set. All visiting commanders will need a permit, granted by The Federation in order to visit Sol or anywhere in the Solar system. However, all Alpha and Beta backers will be given an automatic permit, without having to first earn a reputation with The Federation. (For those of you whose allegiances lie elsewhere this could be a very useful benefit indeed!).
This sounds great

Elite: Dangerous is releasing on 16/12/2014 (12/16/2014 for Americans)

Looks like Gamma will be short.

so will the planet landings and walking around definitely be DLCs? or just updates?

- - - Updated - - -

Elite: Dangerous is releasing on 16/12/2014 (12/16/2014 for Americans)

Looks like Gamma will be short.

gamma was only a development phase for planetary annihilation

gamma was only a development phase for planetary annihilation

Elite was planned to have a Gamma, go to the Frontier forums. Read them.

wait how did you do that

With Paint.

so will the planet landings and walking around definitely be DLCs? or just updates?

...

Never heard something else than that EVA would be part of coming DLCs.

Landing on planets however may very well be part of updates (after all this was included in previous Elite-titles as well ... you were able to land on planetary spaceports and also were able to land on unowned planets/moons in order to plant/retrieve mining devices there)

Never heard something else than that EVA would be part of coming DLCs.

Landing on planets however may very well be part of updates (after all this was included in previous Elite-titles as well ... you were able to land on planetary spaceports and also were able to land on unowned planets/moons in order to plant/retrieve mining devices there)

The devs have gone on record saying that landing on planets and EVA's (walking inside and outside your ship, on stations etc) will be added by future expansions that will need to be purchased separately.
Ah O.K. ... well, glad I have the backer package that gives you all future DLCs free of charge

Ah O.K. ... well, glad I have the backer package that gives you all future DLCs free of charge
